byline.original: By MARK SCOTT and MIKE ISAAC

abstract: Uber submits $3 billion bid for Here, Nokia-owned service that is the main competitor to Google Maps, as part of its bid to expand into a logistics company; Uber currently relies heavily on Google for its livery and logistics services; heavy bidding highlights rising importance of digital mapping services as companies seek to connect their devices to the Internet.
lead_paragraph: The battle to buy Here highlights the growing importance of digital mapping services as companies connect their products to the Internet.

headline.main: Uber Joins the Bidding for Here, Nokia’s Digital Mapping Service
headline.print_headline: Uber Joins the Bidding for a Mapping Service

snippet: The battle to buy Here highlights the growing importance of digital mapping services as companies connect their products to the Internet.
